content.description:
This climbs the left most crack on the LingHall wall. Start on a thin crack that widens as it goes up the cliff. Start on this thin finger size crack, the first few move will make you work then the crack widens providing better rests. Follow the crack up to the awesome chock stone and pull the lip. There is a fur anchor

This climbing starts in the center of the LingHall wall and follows the left slanting crack. To access LingHall ledge you must climb Colorado Cowboy, Gringos Last Stand or bush whack up the back gully and rap down to it.
Take small to large cams, a #3 cam is nice to have

Walk to the right edge of the LingHall ledge over around a small corner to reveal and great slaby corner, finishing with a perfect corner hand crack. This climb is a gem and the exposure is marvelous.

This climb is located on the right hand side of LingHall ledge. To access LingHall ledge you must climb Colorado Cowboy, Gringos Last Stand or bush whack up the back gully and rap down to it.
Bring a rack.

Climb the corner found on the uphill, right, side of the LingHall ledge. Move onto the face and climb up cracks to a tree. The right most route of the three found on the wall.

right side of LingHall Ledge
Bring a Rack

This climbs the kind of loose looking flake and the crack to the right of it for the first 10 feet to access the sweet but short ringlock crack. This crack will be tricky to get a jam but finishes on a nice ledge, walk left to the tree anchor.

This climb starts a little right of the center of the LingHall wall where there is a large flake protruding from the wall. To access LingHall ledge you must climb Colorado Cowboy, Gringos Last Stand or bush whack up the back gully and rap down to it.
Bring a rack
The LingHall ledge can be access by climbing gringos last stand or Colorado Cowboy and can also be access by repel if you walk up the back gully. This is a large ledge with 4 climbs off of it.
